heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Valuation Act 2001 (Global Valuation)
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Valuation Act 2001 (Global Valuation) 

(Apportionment) (Electricity Supply Board) Order 2024. 

In this Order “Act of 2001” means the Valuation Act 2001 (No. 13 of

title: the Valuation Act 2001 (No. 13 of 2001) and the Global Valuation (Transfer of
the Valuation Act 2001 (No. 13 of 2001) and the Global Valuation (Transfer of
heading: 3. (1) Tailte Éireann shall apportion the global valuation of the Electricity
text_raw:
3. (1) Tailte Éireann shall apportion the global valuation of the Electricity 
Supply Board, determined pursuant to section 53(6)(a) of the Act of 2001, 
between each of the rating authorities in whose areas property comprised in the 
valuation is situate in accordance with paragraph (2). 

(2) The apportionment referred to in paragraph (1) shall be in the proportion, 
expressed as a percentage, that the population resident in the area of each such 
rating authority, as determined by the census of population taken under the 
Statistics (Census of Population) Order 2020 (S. I. No. 637 of 2020), bears to the 
total population of those rating authorities as so determined.

title: the Valuation Act 2001 (No. 13 of 2001) and the Global Valuation (Transfer of
heading: In respect of the period for which an existing valuation list remains in
text_raw:
4. 

In respect of the period for which an existing valuation list remains in 
force in relation to the area of a rating authority to which Article 3 refers, the 
valuation apportioned to such authority under that Article shall be multiplied by 
a factor of 0.002343 to establish the adjusted global valuation for the area of the 
rating authority to be specified in the central valuation list pursuant to section 58 
of the Act of 2001.
text_norm: 4 respect period existing valuation list remains force relation area rating authority article 3 refers valuation apportioned authority article shall multiplied factor 0.002343 establish adjusted global valuation area rating authority specified central valuation list pursuant section 58 act 2001

title: the Valuation Act 2001 (No. 13 of 2001) and the Global Valuation (Transfer of
heading: 5. (1) The apportioned and adjusted global valuation for each rating
text_raw:
5. (1) The apportioned and adjusted global valuation for each rating 
authority determined in accordance with this Order, shall, subject to paragraph 
(2), be rounded to the nearest whole euro. 

(2) Where the apportioned and adjusted global valuation referred to in 
paragraph (1) results in the amount concerned being an amount in euro and 50 
cent or greater than 50 cent that amount shall be rounded upwards to the nearest 
whole euro. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 22nd October, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [547] 3 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

18 October, 2024. 

DARRAH O’BRIEN, 

Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage.

title: the Valuation Act 2001 (No. 13 of 2001) and the Global Valuation (Transfer of
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This order provides for the apportionment of the global valuation of the 
Electricity Supply Board, between each of the rating authorities in whose areas 
property comprised in the valuation of the Electricity Supply Board is situated. 
The apportionment for each rating authority is to be determined by population 
within rating authority area, according to the Census of Population published by 
the Central Statistics Office. The Order sets out an adjustment factor, 
determined by Tailte Éireann, to make the valuation relative to existing valuation 
lists in those rating authorities which have not to date undergone a revaluation 
under Part 5 of the Valuation Acts 2001 to 2020.
